description: Gets information about the Auto Scaling groups in the account and Region. If you specify Auto Scaling group names, the output includes information for only the specified Auto Scaling groups. If you specify filters, the output includes information for only those Auto Scaling groups that meet the filter criteria. If you do not specify group names or filters, the output includes information for all Auto Scaling groups. This operation also returns information about instances in Auto Scaling groups. To retrieve information about the instances in a warm pool, you must call the DescribeWarmPool API.

parameters.name: AutoScalingGroupNames
parameters.description: The names of the Auto Scaling groups. By default, you can only specify up to 50 names. You can optionally increase this limit using the MaxRecords property. If you omit this property, all Auto Scaling groups are described. (string) ---

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: One or more filters to limit the results based on specific tags. (dict) --- Describes a filter that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. If you specify multiple filters, the filters are automatically logically joined with an AND, and the request returns only the results that match all of the specified filters. For more information, see Tag Auto Scaling groups and instances in the Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling User Guide. Name (string) --- The name of the filter. The valid values for Name depend on which API operation you're using with the filter ( DescribeAutoScalingGroups or DescribeTags). Valid values for Name include the following: tag-key - Accepts tag keys. The results only include information about the Auto Scaling groups associated with these tag keys. tag-value - Accepts tag values. The results only include information about the Auto Scaling groups associated with these tag values. tag:<key> - Accepts the key/value combination of the tag. Use the tag key in the filter name and the tag value as the filter value. The results only include information about the Auto Scaling groups associated with the specified key/value combination. Valid values for Name include the following: auto-scaling-group - Accepts the names of Auto Scaling groups. The results only include information about the tags associated with these Auto Scaling groups. key - Accepts tag keys. The results only include information about the tags associated with these tag keys. value - Accepts tag values. The results only include information about the tags associated with these tag values. propagate-at-launch - Accepts a Boolean value, which specifies whether tags propagate to instances at launch. The results only include information about the tags associated with the specified Boolean value. Values (list) --- One or more filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are automatically logically joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values. For example, specify 'tag:environment' for the filter name and 'production,development' for the filter values to find Auto Scaling groups with the tag 'environment=production' or 'environment=development'. (string) ---

nested_params.name: Name
nested_params.description: The name of the filter. The valid values for Name depend on which API operation you're using with the filter ( DescribeAutoScalingGroups or DescribeTags). Valid values for Name include the following:

nested_params.name: Values
nested_params.description: One or more filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are automatically logically joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values. For example, specify 'tag:environment' for the filter name and 'production,development' for the filter values to find Auto Scaling groups with the tag 'environment=production' or 'environment=development'.

nested_items.name: AutoScalingGroups
nested_items.description: The groups.

nested_items.name: AutoScalingGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the Auto Scaling group.

nested_items.name: AutoScalingGroupARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Auto Scaling group.

nested_items.name: LaunchConfigurationName
nested_items.description: The name of the associated launch configuration.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplate
nested_items.description: The launch template for the group.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateId
nested_items.description: The ID of the launch template. To get the template ID, use the Amazon EC2 DescribeLaunchTemplates API operation. New launch templates can be created using the Amazon EC2 CreateLaunchTemplate API.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateName
nested_items.description: The name of the launch template. To get the template name, use the Amazon EC2 DescribeLaunchTemplates API operation. New launch templates can be created using the Amazon EC2 CreateLaunchTemplate API.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The version number, $Latest, or $Default. To get the version number, use the Amazon EC2 DescribeLaunchTemplateVersions API operation. New launch template versions can be created using the Amazon EC2 CreateLaunchTemplateVersion API. If the value is $Latest, Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling selects the latest version of the launch template when launching instances. If the value is $Default, Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling selects the default version of the launch template when launching instances. The default value is $Default.

nested_items.name: MixedInstancesPolicy
nested_items.description: The mixed instances policy for the group.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplate
nested_items.description: One or more launch templates and the instance types (overrides) that are used to launch EC2 instances to fulfill On-Demand and Spot capacities.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateSpecification
nested_items.description: The launch template.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateId
nested_items.description: The ID of the launch template. To get the template ID, use the Amazon EC2 DescribeLaunchTemplates API operation. New launch templates can be created using the Amazon EC2 CreateLaunchTemplate API.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateName
nested_items.description: The name of the launch template. To get the template name, use the Amazon EC2 DescribeLaunchTemplates API operation. New launch templates can be created using the Amazon EC2 CreateLaunchTemplate API.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The version number, $Latest, or $Default. To get the version number, use the Amazon EC2 DescribeLaunchTemplateVersions API operation. New launch template versions can be created using the Amazon EC2 CreateLaunchTemplateVersion API. If the value is $Latest, Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling selects the latest version of the launch template when launching instances. If the value is $Default, Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling selects the default version of the launch template when launching instances. The default value is $Default.

nested_items.name: Overrides
nested_items.description: Any properties that you specify override the same properties in the launch template.
Override the instance type that is specified in the launch template.
Use multiple instance types.

nested_items.name: InstancesDistribution
nested_items.description: The instances distribution.

nested_items.name: OnDemandAllocationStrategy
nested_items.description: The allocation strategy to apply to your On-Demand Instances when they are launched. Possible instance types are determined by the launch template overrides that you specify.

nested_items.name: OnDemandBaseCapacity
nested_items.description: The minimum amount of the Auto Scaling group's capacity that must be fulfilled by On-Demand Instances. This base portion is launched first as your group scales.

nested_items.name: OnDemandPercentageAboveBaseCapacity
nested_items.description: Controls the percentages of On-Demand Instances and Spot Instances for your additional capacity beyond OnDemandBaseCapacity. Expressed as a number (for example, 20 specifies 20% On-Demand Instances, 80% Spot Instances). If set to 100, only On-Demand Instances are used.

nested_items.name: SpotAllocationStrategy
nested_items.description: The allocation strategy to apply to your Spot Instances when they are launched. Possible instance types are determined by the launch template overrides that you specify.

nested_items.name: SpotInstancePools
nested_items.description: The number of Spot Instance pools across which to allocate your Spot Instances. The Spot pools are determined from the different instance types in the overrides. Valid only when the SpotAllocationStrategy is lowest-price. Value must be in the range of 1---20.

nested_items.name: SpotMaxPrice
nested_items.description: The maximum price per unit hour that you are willing to pay for a Spot Instance. If your maximum price is lower than the Spot price for the instance types that you selected, your Spot Instances are not launched. We do not recommend specifying a maximum price because it can lead to increased interruptions. When Spot Instances launch, you pay the current Spot price. To remove a maximum price that you previously set, include the property but specify an empty string ('') for the value.

nested_items.name: MinSize
nested_items.description: The minimum size of the group.

nested_items.name: MaxSize
nested_items.description: The maximum size of the group.

nested_items.name: DesiredCapacity
nested_items.description: The desired size of the group.

nested_items.name: PredictedCapacity
nested_items.description: The predicted capacity of the group when it has a predictive scaling policy.

nested_items.name: DefaultCooldown
nested_items.description: The duration of the default cooldown period, in seconds.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZones
nested_items.description: One or more Availability Zones for the group.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: LoadBalancerNames
nested_items.description: One or more load balancers associated with the group.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: TargetGroupARNs
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Names (ARN) of the target groups for your load balancer.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: HealthCheckType
nested_items.description: A comma-separated value string of one or more health check types.

nested_items.name: HealthCheckGracePeriod
nested_items.description: The duration of the health check grace period, in seconds.

nested_items.name: Instances
nested_items.description: The EC2 instances associated with the group.

nested_items.name: InstanceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the instance.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The instance type of the EC2 instance.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone in which the instance is running.

nested_items.name: LifecycleState
nested_items.description: A description of the current lifecycle state. The Quarantined state is not used. For more information, see Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling instance lifecycle in the Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling User Guide.

nested_items.name: HealthStatus
nested_items.description: The last reported health status of the instance. Healthy means that the instance is healthy and should remain in service. Unhealthy means that the instance is unhealthy and that Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling should terminate and replace it.

nested_items.name: LaunchConfigurationName
nested_items.description: The launch configuration associated with the instance.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplate
nested_items.description: The launch template for the instance.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateId
nested_items.description: The ID of the launch template. To get the template ID, use the Amazon EC2 DescribeLaunchTemplates API operation. New launch templates can be created using the Amazon EC2 CreateLaunchTemplate API.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateName
nested_items.description: The name of the launch template. To get the template name, use the Amazon EC2 DescribeLaunchTemplates API operation. New launch templates can be created using the Amazon EC2 CreateLaunchTemplate API.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The version number, $Latest, or $Default. To get the version number, use the Amazon EC2 DescribeLaunchTemplateVersions API operation. New launch template versions can be created using the Amazon EC2 CreateLaunchTemplateVersion API. If the value is $Latest, Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling selects the latest version of the launch template when launching instances. If the value is $Default, Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling selects the default version of the launch template when launching instances. The default value is $Default.

nested_items.name: ProtectedFromScaleIn
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the instance is protected from termination by Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling when scaling in.

nested_items.name: WeightedCapacity
nested_items.description: The number of capacity units contributed by the instance based on its instance type.

nested_items.name: CreatedTime
nested_items.description: The date and time the group was created.

nested_items.name: SuspendedProcesses
nested_items.description: The suspended processes associated with the group.

nested_items.name: ProcessName
nested_items.description: The name of the suspended process.

nested_items.name: SuspensionReason
nested_items.description: The reason that the process was suspended.

nested_items.name: PlacementGroup
nested_items.description: The name of the placement group into which to launch your instances, if any.

nested_items.name: VPCZoneIdentifier
nested_items.description: One or more subnet IDs, if applicable, separated by commas.

nested_items.name: EnabledMetrics
nested_items.description: The metrics enabled for the group.

nested_items.name: Metric
nested_items.description: One of the following metrics:
GroupMinSize.
GroupMaxSize.
GroupDesiredCapacity.
GroupInServiceInstances.
GroupPendingInstances.
GroupStandbyInstances.
GroupTerminatingInstances.
GroupTotalInstances.
GroupInServiceCapacity.
GroupPendingCapacity.
GroupStandbyCapacity.
GroupTerminatingCapacity.
GroupTotalCapacity.
WarmPoolDesiredCapacity.
WarmPoolWarmedCapacity.
WarmPoolPendingCapacity.
WarmPoolTerminatingCapacity.
WarmPoolTotalCapacity.
GroupAndWarmPoolDesiredCapacity.
GroupAndWarmPoolTotalCapacity.

nested_items.name: Granularity
nested_items.description: The granularity of the metric. The only valid value is 1Minute.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current state of the group when the DeleteAutoScalingGroup operation is in progress.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The tags for the group.

nested_items.name: ResourceId
nested_items.description: The name of the group.

nested_items.name: ResourceType
nested_items.description: The type of resource. The only supported value is auto-scaling-group.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The tag key.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The tag value.

nested_items.name: PropagateAtLaunch
nested_items.description: Determines whether the tag is added to new instances as they are launched in the group.

nested_items.name: TerminationPolicies
nested_items.description: The termination policies for the group.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: NewInstancesProtectedFromScaleIn
nested_items.description: Indicates whether newly launched instances are protected from termination by Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling when scaling in. For more information about preventing instances from terminating on scale in, see Use instance scale-in protection in the Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling User Guide.

nested_items.name: ServiceLinkedRoleARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the service-linked role that the Auto Scaling group uses to call other Amazon Web Services on your behalf.

nested_items.name: MaxInstanceLifetime
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of time, in seconds, that an instance can be in service.

nested_items.name: CapacityRebalance
nested_items.description: Indicates whether Capacity Rebalancing is enabled.

nested_items.name: WarmPoolConfiguration
nested_items.description: The warm pool for the group.

nested_items.name: MaxGroupPreparedCapacity
nested_items.description: The maximum number of instances that are allowed to be in the warm pool or in any state except Terminated for the Auto Scaling group.

nested_items.name: MinSize
nested_items.description: The minimum number of instances to maintain in the warm pool.

nested_items.name: PoolState
nested_items.description: The instance state to transition to after the lifecycle actions are complete.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of a warm pool that is marked for deletion.

nested_items.name: InstanceReusePolicy
nested_items.description: The instance reuse policy.

nested_items.name: ReuseOnScaleIn
nested_items.description: Specifies whether instances in the Auto Scaling group can be returned to the warm pool on scale in.

nested_items.name: WarmPoolSize
nested_items.description: The current size of the warm pool.

nested_items.name: Context
nested_items.description: Reserved.

nested_items.name: DesiredCapacityType
nested_items.description: The unit of measurement for the value specified for desired capacity. Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling supports DesiredCapacityType for attribute-based instance type selection only.

nested_items.name: DefaultInstanceWarmup
nested_items.description: The duration of the default instance warmup, in seconds.

nested_items.name: TrafficSources
nested_items.description: The traffic sources associated with this Auto Scaling group.

nested_items.name: Identifier
nested_items.description: Identifies the traffic source.
Application Load Balancer ARN: arn:aws:elasticloadbalancing:us-west-2:123456789012:targetgroup/my-targets/1234567890123456
Classic Load Balancer name: my-classic-load-balancer.
VPC Lattice ARN: arn:aws:vpc-lattice:us-west-2:123456789012:targetgroup/tg-1234567890123456

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: Provides additional context for the value of Identifier.
elb if Identifier is the name of a Classic Load Balancer.
elbv2 if Identifier is the ARN of an Application Load Balancer, Gateway Load Balancer, or Network Load Balancer target group.
vpc-lattice if Identifier is the ARN of a VPC Lattice target group.

nested_items.name: InstanceMaintenancePolicy
nested_items.description: An instance maintenance policy.

nested_items.name: MinHealthyPercentage
nested_items.description: Specifies the lower threshold as a percentage of the desired capacity of the Auto Scaling group. It represents the minimum percentage of the group to keep in service, healthy, and ready to use to support your workload when replacing instances. Value range is 0 to 100. To clear a previously set value, specify a value of -1.

nested_items.name: MaxHealthyPercentage
nested_items.description: Specifies the upper threshold as a percentage of the desired capacity of the Auto Scaling group. It represents the maximum percentage of the group that can be in service and healthy, or pending, to support your workload when replacing instances. Value range is 100 to 200. To clear a previously set value, specify a value of -1.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZoneDistribution
nested_items.description: The instance capacity distribution across Availability Zones.

nested_items.name: CapacityDistributionStrategy
nested_items.description: If launches fail in an Availability Zone, the following strategies are available. The default is balanced-best-effort.
balanced-only - If launches fail in an Availability Zone, Auto Scaling will continue to attempt to launch in the unhealthy zone to preserve a balanced distribution.
balanced-best-effort - If launches fail in an Availability Zone, Auto Scaling will attempt to launch in another healthy Availability Zone instead.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZoneImpairmentPolicy
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone impairment policy.

nested_items.name: ZonalShiftEnabled
nested_items.description: If true, enable zonal shift for your Auto Scaling group.

nested_items.name: ImpairedZoneHealthCheckBehavior
nested_items.description: Specifies the health check behavior for the impaired Availability Zone in an active zonal shift. If you select Replace unhealthy, instances that appear unhealthy will be replaced in all Availability Zones. If you select Ignore unhealthy, instances will not be replaced in the Availability Zone with the active zonal shift. For more information, see Auto Scaling group zonal shift in the Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling User Guide.

nested_items.name: CapacityReservationSpecification
nested_items.description: The capacity reservation specification.

nested_items.name: CapacityReservationPreference
nested_items.description: The capacity reservation preference. The following options are available:
capacity-reservations-only - Auto Scaling will only launch instances into a Capacity Reservation or Capacity Reservation resource group. If capacity isn't available, instances will fail to launch.

capacity-reservations-first - Auto Scaling will try to launch instances into a Capacity Reservation or Capacity Reservation resource group first. If capacity isn't available, instances will run in On-Demand capacity.
none - Auto Scaling will not launch instances into a Capacity Reservation. Instances will run in On-Demand capacity.
default - Auto Scaling uses the Capacity Reservation preference from your launch template or an open Capacity Reservation.

nested_items.name: CapacityReservationTarget
nested_items.description: Describes a target Capacity Reservation or Capacity Reservation resource group.

nested_items.name: CapacityReservationIds
nested_items.description: The Capacity Reservation IDs to launch instances into.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: CapacityReservationResourceGroupArns
nested_items.description: The resource group ARNs of the Capacity Reservation to launch instances into.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: A string that indicates that the response contains more items than can be returned in a single response. To receive additional items, specify this string for the NextToken value when requesting the next set of items. This value is null when there are no more items to return.
